# firefly3_rule_group (Resource)

Manages a Firefly III rule group. Rule groups are containers for rules and determine the order in which rules are executed.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Basic rule group
resource "firefly3_rule_group" "automation" {
  title = "Automation Rules"
}

# Rule group with all options
resource "firefly3_rule_group" "categorization" {
  title       = "Auto Categorization"
  description = "Automatically categorize transactions based on description"
  active      = true
  order       = 1
}
```

## Import

Rule groups can be imported using their ID:

```bash
terraform import firefly3_rule_group.automation 456
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->

## Schema

### Required

- `title` (String) The title of the rule group.

### Optional

- `active` (Boolean) Whether or not the rule group is active. Defaults to `true`.
- `description` (String) A description of what the rule group is for.
- `order` (Number) The order of the rule group. Rule groups with a lower order are executed first.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The unique identifier of the rule group.
